The claim follows by non-degeneracy of the inner product on $Y$.

[Claim 2] Let $|f_n|_\alpha <1$, and $\lim_n f_n(x) = 0$ for all $x\in [0,1]$. Then $f_n\to 0$ in $C^\beta$ for all $\beta\in (0, \alpha)$ Proof of [Claim 2]. A bounded set in $C^\alpha$ is precompact in $C^\beta$. Thus, any subsequence has its own subsequence $f_{n_k} \to g$ in $C^\beta$. By pointwise convergence, we must have $g= 0$. QED
